definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
Saraswati (the Hindu goddess of wisdom and arts and consort of Lord Brahma)

sentences.english: The eloquence of the President moved all hearts who listened to him.
sentences.chinese: 總統的辯才感動了所有聆聽者的心。

sentences.english: The hired orators continued to pour forth their streams of eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 那些僱來的演說家繼續滔滔不絕地施展辯才。

sentences.english: Poet is born, but orator is made.
Some politicians are famous for their powers of oratory.
sentences.chinese: 有些政治家以辯才著稱。

sentences.english: For vast kalpas I have possessed unobstructed eloquence.
For thee, against my self I'll vow debate.
sentences.chinese: 我爲你將展盡辯才反對自己。

sentences.english: In the future will achieve Buddhahood, four eloquences, will be the third first mate newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 未來成佛，得四辯才，是名第三大副報。

sentences.english: And they will achieve all wisdom and obtain wonderful eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 成就一切智慧，獲得無邊辯才。
他的辯才使得我們啞口無言。

sentences.english: She was renowned for her eloquence and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 她以其辯才和美貌着稱。

sentences.english: Your ability to argue is of little avail if the facts are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 如果論據是錯的，你的辯才也就沒有什麼用了。

sentences.english: I admire the oratory of some politicians.
sentences.chinese: 我佩服某些政治家的辯才。

definition: School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to be in overall charge/to oversee
